meanings.definition: Crushed or ground food, especially potatoes
meanings.sent1: I made a delicious potato mash for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The chef prepared a creamy mash to accompany the steak.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy mash on top of the shepherd's pie was irresistible.
meanings.sent4: The mash of flavors in the stew created a comforting meal.
meanings.sent5: The smooth potato mash melted in my mouth.

meanings.definition: To crush or squeeze something into a soft mass
meanings.sent1: She used a fork to mash the avocado for guacamole.
meanings.sent2: Please mash the bananas before adding them to the batter.
meanings.sent3: He tried to mash all his clothes into a tiny suitcase for the trip.
meanings.sent4: The wrestler managed to mash his opponent to the ground.
meanings.sent5: The heavy rock could easily mash the fragile flower beneath it.

meanings.definition: A mixture of malt or other ingredients with water, heated to convert starches into fermentable sugars
meanings.sent1: The brewer carefully monitored the temperature of the mash.
meanings.sent2: The brewery produced a high-quality mash for brewing beer.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy jumped into the mash and left paw prints everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the mash filled the air during the brewing process.
meanings.sent5: The bubbling mash indicated that fermentation was underway.
